title: Europe's Leaders End Meeting With Call for Interest Rate Cuts to Fight Slump
description: With left-center majorities now in power in most of the 15 countries of the European Union, its leaders ended a weekend summit meeting today in broad agreement that it was time to pursue less restrictive economic and monetary policies to guard against a world recession.

title: Japanese Are Torn Between Efficiency and Egalitarian Values
description: The principal's office in the little country school here has a gleaming new bell and loudspeaker system to broadcast messages and summon the student body from recess. But it would be simpler to yell through the window for Daiki Saito to come in.

title: In the Midst of Today's Chaos, the Middle Ages Echo
description: The music of Arvo Part, the subject of Continuum's concert at the Miller Theater on Saturday night, reaffirms the axiom that new things derive from old ones and that musical frontiers expand along a curve that eventually doubles back on itself.

title: TV Sports Lose Some of Their Power to Reach America's Men
description: For decades, advertisers and agencies could confidently assume that sports would bring them the kinds of consumers they so ardently desired: millions of men who usually limited their own athletic pursuits to dashing to the store to buy whatever products were sponsoring the games played by their favorite teams.

title: DANCE
description: An Adventurous Saxophonist

title: Political Briefing; The Eyes of Texas Are on Race for No. 2
description: The big political question of the moment in Texas is not whether Gov. George W. Bush will win re-election, given that he leads his Democratic challenger, the State Land Commissioner, Garry Mauro, better than 3 to 1. Nor is it whether Mr. Bush might go on to run for President.

title: An Adored Fantasy Series Now Hints at 1990's Angst
description: It has been almost two years since I was last summoned to the land of Andor or asked to contemplate the conspiracies tearing apart Tar Valon. In that time, I have hardly given a thought to Darkfriends and the Forsaken, to the Dragon Reborn or the Age of Legends. And the manners and mythologies of the desert-dwelling Aiel or the seafaring Seanchan have come to seem the half-remembered stuff of dreams.

title: Paid Notice: Memorials  SAMUELS, HOWARD J.
description: SAMUELS-Howard J. 10/26/84. My man for all seasons. Your legacy survives. Love, Doc. B.B.F.

title: Rolston Finds His Stride, And Devils Regain Theirs
description: After watching it on the highlights the next day, even Brian Rolston admitted that he might have been lucky in picking up his first goal of the season last week. But almost as soon as the puck found the net, the Devils left wing found his stride.

title: Election of Judges
description: To the Editor:

title: THIS WEEK
description: EVENTS

title: Republicans Looking to End 126 Years of One-Party Rule
description: For the last eight years, Georgia has boomed, and it has done so under Democratic rule. The state has created jobs faster than any state east of the Mississippi. Its population has exploded by 16 percent, the highest growth in the South. It has eliminated the state tax on groceries. Its five-year-old lottery has provided college scholarships for 319,000 college students and pre-kindergarten classes for 246,000 others.

title: Sports of The Times; Martin's Running Makes a Big Difference for the Jets
description: MORE than anyone else, Vinny Testaverde has an up-close-and-personal appreciation of Curtis Martin.

title: Trying to Resurrect A Palace of Junk; City Longs for Folk Art of Depression That It Tore Down Long Ago
description: Picture, if indeed you can, the kind of castle Dr. Seuss might have built had he moonlighted on a Chevrolet assembly line.

title: Media Talk; ABC News at Odds With Parent Network
description: Many journalists at ABC News are annoyed, to say the least, about the parent network's decision to commission a one-hour prime-time special from the film maker Oliver Stone that will deal, among other things, with the theory that long-range missiles caused the crash of Trans World Airlines Flight 800.

title: European Law Aims to Protect Privacy of Data
description: The European Union put into effect a law today prohibiting American-style buying and selling of personal data, a move that could interrupt electronic commerce with the United States if the two sides fail to resolve deep philosophical and legal differences over protecting privacy.

title: Turkey Places New Limits on Oil Tanker Traffic in Bosporus
description: As competition for pipeline routes out of the Caspian Sea basin intensified, Turkey announced new restrictions this weekend on use of the Bosporus, the strategic waterway that divides Europe from Asia.

title: Op-Art; DEFENSE INTELLIGENCE AGENCY
description: More than 25 years after the United States supported Gen. Augusto Pinochet's military coup in Chile, the Clinton Administration has a chance to help document the crimes committed during his regime. At Spain's request, General Pinochet was arrested in London on Oct. 16. Spain now wants to extradite him. Last year, under a treaty, Spain requested American documents that would help it prosecute the former dictator. So far, the Administration has provided only public papers, like court records and news clippings. The heavily censored D.I.A. report reprinted here, obtained via the Freedom of Information Act, is one page of thousands of secret documents buried in Washington. If the Administration is to uphold its commitments on human rights and fighting terrorism, it must now turn over relevant documents to Spain. PETER KORNBLUH, senior analyst, National Security Archive

title: Texas Nuclear Site
description: To the Editor:

title: The Dawn of HDTV, Ready or Not
description: In six days, the nation begins the Government-mandated changeover to digital broadcasting -- a transition with no real precedent.

title: Small-Plane Crash Kills Pilot, Injures 3
description: One man was killed and three others injured when a small plane approaching Linden Airport struck power lines and crashed yesterday.

title: Election of Rivals in Brazil Hurts Cardoso Reform Plans
description: Rivals of President Fernando Henrique Cardoso won important victories in gubernatorial races today, handing the recently re-elected President a complex landscape for pushing through long-delayed government and economic reforms.

title: With Piazza In the Fold, Hundley Is Packing Up
description: Mike Piazza is set to sign the most lucrative contract in baseball history this afternoon. The left-hander Al Leiter has apparently agreed to all but the fine print of a four-year, $32 million deal that will probably be announced early this week, according to one person close to the negotiations. Now the question is, what becomes of Todd Hundley, the Mets' other All-Star catcher?

description: STEWART-Laura J. (Jacknick) On Friday, October 23. Of Cambridge, MA. Beloved mother of Amelia E. Stewart of Cambridge, MA. Services were held at the Levine Chapel, Brookline, MA, on Sunday, October 25.

description: Gilda and the Usual Suspects

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  AUMANN, ESTHER (NEE SCHLESINGER)
description: AUMANN-Esther (nee Schlesinger). Age 67, wife of Robert John Aumann, passed away October 23, in Jerusalem. Buried on the Mount of Olives in Jerusalem. Esther is survived by her husband, four children, 14 grandchildren, four sisters and a brother. Esther's thirst for knowledge was insatiable, and her interests-and insights-embraced the world. The love and warmth she radiated were reciprocated by all whose lives were touched by hers.

title: Compressed Data; Maker of Music Player Awaits Judge's Decision
description: Diamond Multimedia Systems is waiting on a judge's decision, expected today, to learn whether it can bring its latest invention to market in time for holiday shoppers.

title: Watson to Buy Theratech
description: Watson Pharmaceuticals Inc. said today that it had agreed to acquire Theratech Inc., a maker of drug-delivery products like skin patches, for $300 million in stock. Theratech shareholders will receive 0.26630 to 0.29598 share of common stock depending on Watson's closing price during a set 10-day period. Watson said the deal was valued at about $300 million. Theratech's drug-delivery systems include transdermal patches and oral-controlled release systems. Theratech has 4 products on the market and more than 20 in development, Watson said. The acquisition is expected to close in the first quarter. Watson, which is based here, expects to take a charge of $14 million when the deal closes.

title: The Big City; The Courage To Vote No On Ice Aid
description: IF you were writing an updated version of ''Profiles in Courage,'' you would probably not plan especially long chapters on either Alfonse M. D'Amato or Charles E. Schumer. But during their race for the Senate, besides calling each other names, they have presented New Yorkers with one shining moment of heroism.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  FONDILER, SAMUEL I.
description: FONDILER-Samuel I. On October 24, 1998, in Boynton Beach, Florida. Beloved husband of Rena. Adored father of Susan (Fred), Ellen, and the late Arthur. Cherished grandpa of Jon, Lexy, Mollie, Ben, Alison and Willie. Dear brother to Sophie and Lester (Laraine). Sam was the Senior Vice President, Finance, for Seaboard World Airlines (1950-1981) and was an officer and consultant for Flying Tiger Line, Inc. (1981-1984), both New York Stock Exchange companies. He was also the Founder, Chairman and CEO of Tower Air (1984-1988). He was a leader in the aviation business community. Sam was a special person who achieved the profound respect and admiration of his business colleagues, but most important generated the deepest love and warmth throughout his family and his wide circle of friends. Funeral Tuesday, October 27, at 1 PM, Riverside-Nassau North Chapels, 55 North Station Plaza, Great Neck, NY. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Arthur Fondiler History Fund, c/o The University of Michigan, College of LS&A, Development Office, 350 Thayer Street, Ann Arbor, MI 48104-1608.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  CALDERONE, DR. MARY S.
description: CALDERONE-Dr. Mary S. The Board of Directors and staff of SIECUS mourn the passing of Mary S. Calderone, our co-founder and President, 1964-1982. Dr. Calderone's vision and commitment will forever be our inspiration. We extend our heartfelt sympathy to her family. William Yarber, Chair Debra W. Haffner, President Sexuality Information and Education Council of the United States

title: A Night for Johnny Mercer's Partners and a Few of His Words
description: ''Days of Wine and Roses,'' the opening concert of the season for the Carnegie Hall Jazz Band on Thursday night, ac-cent-tchu-ated all the most positive aspects of the group and its vision. It was an all-Johnny Mercer program, and because there was no vocalist for more than half the concert to sing Mercer's words (Nnenna Freelon joined the band for four numbers), it was also a Harold Arlen, Hoagy Carmichael, Jerome Kern, Harry Warren, Ziggy Elman and Henry Mancini program. Good material was not an issue.

title: Political Briefing; Courting Blacks In Maryland Contest
description: If Gov. Parris N. Glendening of Maryland, a Democrat, is to win re-election this year, he needs a big turnout by black voters, the fastest-growing political force in the state. But getting that turnout won't be easy.

title: POLITICAL PARTIES CHANNEL MILLIONS TO 'ISSUE' ATTACKS
description: State Representative David Phelps, who is running for Congress in Southern Illinois, was not surprised when television stations began broadcasting an advertisement criticizing his record earlier this month. A Democrat, Mr. Phelps was prepared for things to get nasty in his race against Brent Winters, the Republican candidate, for an open seat in the 19th Congressional District.

description: DEAN-Dr. Martin L. Green Brook Country Club deeply mourns the passing of member Dr. Martin L. Dean, and extends heartfelt condolences to his wife Jane, and to the entire family.

description: It was all white men on the Supreme Court who handed down the milestone rulings that helped decide the fate of American Indians more than a century ago.

description: Declaring that he is troubled by the Central Intelligence Agency's role in a new Middle East peace accord, Senator Richard C. Shelby, the chairman of the Select Committee on Intelligence, said today that he would hold hearings to investigate the matter.

title: Democrat or Republican, Woman Will Be Winner
description: Patty Murray swept into the United States Senate in 1992's ''Year of the Woman'' in the wake of national outrage over the all-male Senate Judiciary Committee's handling of sexual harassment accusations against a Supreme Court nominee. Six years later, in Ms. Murray's campaign, a woman is once again standing up for feminist values on the campaign trail -- ''fighting against leches in the workplace who hit on young women,'' as she puts it.

title: Economic Calendar
description: Expected dates for the release of major economic indicators this week.

title: New York Faults Hospital for Denying Checkup to Baby Who Starved
description: On a rainy day last February, a mother and her 1-week-old baby daughter were turned away from a scheduled checkup at an outpatient clinic of New York Methodist Hospital in Brooklyn for lack of money or a Medicaid card.

title: Unusually Tight Race Draws Statewide Spotlight to Corner of Brooklyn

There, with a tidy row of brownstones as a picturesque backdrop, a seemingly endless array of local and state Republican candidates came to an old-fashioned political rally to salute their party's candidate for a State Senate seat representing Brooklyn and Staten Island.

title: Corrections

Twenty-one children, 4 to 12 years old, were reporting for a party -- hamburgers and hot dogs, sack races and musical chairs, bags of goodies to be collected.
