Services Sunday, November 1st, 9:30AM, Gutterman Musicant Funeral Home, Hackensack, NJ.

title: Late Goal Nullified, Rewarding Gritty Play
description: The Rangers are not winning games this season with finesse or style. They have borrowed a new look, have taken on a different personality -- that of a blue-collar, hard-working team.

title: INSIDE
description: Pinochet Extradition Backed

title: World Briefing
description: EUROPE

title: Dick Higgins, 60, Innovator In the 1960's Avant-Garde
description: Dick Higgins, a writer, poet, artist, composer and publisher who was a seminal figure in Happenings and the concrete poetry movement and a co-founder of the anti-authoritarian Fluxus movement in the early 1960's, died on Sunday while visiting Quebec City. He was 60 and lived in New York City and in Barrytown, N.Y.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  GOLD, LEONARD M.
description: GOLD-Leonard M. On October 29, 1998. Beloved husband of Lois M. Adored father of Eric M. Devoted son of Martha R. and the late Samuel M. Loving brother of Martin R. & uncle to David and Jonathan Gold and Joshua Stephens. A man of great sensitivity and love for his family and friends, he will be greatly missed by all of us. Service on Monday, November 2, at 11:30AM at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Avenue at 81 Street. Donations in his memory may be made to the American Brain Tumor Association, 2720 River Road, Des Plaines, IL. 60018-4110.

title: Isles Reject Palffy's Proposal
description: Maybe the Islanders' fans should have kept those squeezable stress pucks they peppered the Nassau Coliseum ice with on Thursday night. After yesterday's developments in the Zigmund Palffy negotiations, they will need some stress relief.

title: Industrial Output Rises in South Korea
description: South Korea's industrial production rose three-tenths of 1 percent in September, compared with a year earlier, down from a 10.2 percent year-over-year increase in September 1997, the Ministry of Finance and Economy said yesterday.

title: 'Hacktivists' of All Persuasions Take Their Struggle to the Web
description: Until they declared ''Netwar'' against the Mexican Government, Ricardo Dominguez and Stefan Wray earned their activist credentials the old-fashioned way, attending rallies in support of the Zapatista rebels, handing out pamphlets, shouting political slogans.

title: Candidates Set a Record In Campaign for Senate
description: Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato and Representative Charles E. Schumer, who have long been among the most masterly fund-raisers in politics, have collected more in campaign contributions in the closely contested New York Senate race than any other pair of candidates in Congressional history.

title: Black Pastors Hear Clinton Appeal for Voter Turnout
description: President Clinton appealed to African-American ministers yesterday to urge their parishioners to turn out and vote as part of a campaign to mobilize some of his most loyal supporters in the closing days of the election season.

title: U.S. Ambassador to Eritrea Quit Amid Sex Inquiry, Officials Say
description: The United States Ambassador to Eritrea resigned last year after State Department investigators determined that he had engaged in sexual misconduct, the White House said today.

title: In Rockies, Democrats Try Pushing G.O.P. Sea
description: It could have been a scene from ''The Milagro Beanfield War,'' the Robert Redford movie about Hispanic farmers' fighting for water rights here in northern New Mexico. Under the balcony of an adobe meeting hall, Roberto Mondragon, the lion-maned actor who played a farmer in the 1988 film, addressed Hispanic ranchers and farmers at a political rally here.

title: Is a Woman's Right to Choose in Jeopardy?
description: To the Editor:

title: TRANSACTIONS
description: BASEBALL

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  SPAR, HERMAN
description: SPAR-Herman. On October 30, 1998. Retired Comptroller Saks 5th Avenue and a volunteer at Eye Bank for Sight Restoration. Beloved husband of the late Anne M. Survived by nephews. Funeral services will be held at Gramercy Park Memorial Chapel, 152 Second Avenue (9th & 10th), New York City Sunday 9:30AM. Interment Beth Moses Cemetery.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KELLEHER, M. EILEEN
description: KELLEHER-M. Eileen. 79. Of Norwich, CT. Beloved wife of the late Dr. James H. Kelleher. Died October 29, 1998 after a brief illness. Devoted mother of Michael of Chevy Chase, MD; Kathleen Belinga of Columbia, SC; Colleen Halloran of Dover, MA; Jane Sobolov of Goffstown, NH; Sara Ann Klemmer of Sherborn, MA; Mary Courtney Kelleher of Groton, CT. Loving ''Gam'' to 13 grandchildren. Also survived by her sister Jean Duffy of Norwich, CT. Mrs. Kelleher formerly of Brooklyn and Manhattan, NY, was the daughter of the late Francis V. and Mary Courtney Duffy. She is predeceased by her brothers Hugh V. and Francis P. Duffy. She was a graduate of Manhattanville College and Fordham University School of Social Services. The family will receive friends at the Cummings-Gagne Funeral Home, 82 Cliff Street, Norwich from 24PM on Sunday, November 1. A mass of Christian Burial will be on Monday, November 2 at 10AM at St. Patrick's Cathedral, 213 Broadway, Norwich. Interment will follow at St. Joseph's Cemetery in Norwich. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to the Association of Retarded Citizens of New London County, 1616 Route 12, P.O. Box 361, Gales Ferry, CT 06335, attn: Greg McMahon; or Easter Seals of Southeastern Connecticut, Norwich-New London Turnpike, Uncasville, CT 06382.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  KIEVAL, ADELINE
description: KIEVAL-Adeline. We mourn the loss of our esteemed member and extend heartfelt condolences to her family. Temple Israel of Great Neck. Sidney Freedman, President

title: Prisoner Leapt to Death Despite Plea for Suicide Watch
description: A distraught 19-year-old who committed suicide on Thursday by jumping out of a 16th-floor window of the Manhattan Criminal Courts building had been ordered placed on a suicide watch several weeks earlier, but the order was never acted on, city officials said yesterday. And a request filed five months ago to install bars on the windows to prevent suicides was apparently lost somewhere in the state and city bureaucracy.

title: Louima Buys Gun for Protection From Officers, His Lawyer Says
description: Abner Louima, who prosecutors say was tortured and threatened by police officers in Brooklyn, has bought a gun out of fear that the accused officers might seek to harm him, one of his lawyers said yesterday.

title: Grant and Kelly Win Titles
description: Mike Grant of Columbia and Ariana Kelly of Yale, who each finished fourth last year, won the men's and women's titles in the Heptagonal Games Association cross-country championship at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx yesterday.

title: Vallone Is Sidelined for Day by Car Accident
description: Peter F. Vallone's uphill campaign for governor received an unsettling setback yesterday when his car was hit from behind by a van driven by a photographer. Mr. Vallone, the Democratic candidate, was not seriously injured and declined medical treatment at the scene. He later went to Western Queens Medical Center, where he was treated for bruises on his neck and back and released.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: KEYSPAN ENERGY CO., Brooklyn, a natural gas and electric company, said it planned to repurchase as much as 10 percent, or about $500 million, of its shares.

title: Images of Love and Death In Mute Modern Severity
description: In their flesh-toned attire, the eight dancers in American Ballet Theater's latest premiere, ''Without Words,'' are like clay figurines molded and remolded into countless configurations by their sculptor-choreographer, Nacho Duato.

title: Teen-Age Refugees From Violence Died in Swedish Disco
description: They were teen-agers whose parents had brought them here from homes torn by war or terror -- from Bosnia, Eritrea, Somalia and others -- and in their new country they formed new bonds, through school and music and parties.

title: Hugh Auchincloss, Surgeon, Dies at 83
description: Hugh Auchincloss, a retired surgeon long associated with Columbia University and Valley Hospital in Ridgewood, N.J., died on Sunday at his home in Westwood, Mass. He was 83. The cause was Alzheimer's disease, his family said.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Nation's Economic Output Surpasses Expectations

title: Political Wives Cast as Leads In TV Testimonials for Votes
description: A 61-year-old woman smiles reassuringly into the camera and tells viewers that Kenneth H. MacKay, the Democrat running for Florida governor, is an all-around great guy.

title: THE MARKETS: COMMODITIES
description: NATURAL GAS FALLS 3.1 PERCENT. Prices weakened on forecasts for mild weather, which would reduce demand for heating fuel. The December contract declined 7.3 cents, to $2.275 for 1,000 cubic feet.

title: More to Food Than Meets The Tongue
description: What is it about New York Jews and Chinese food? During a recent rainy afternoon in a basement classroom at New York University, graduate students were discussing why Jewish immigrants from Eastern Europe were originally drawn to such an alien cuisine and how Chinese restaurants became integral to the experience of Jewish assimilation.

title: Fight, With HBO's Help, Is Back From the Dead
description: The ring entrance that Prince Naseem Hamed has planned for his featherweight world championship bout on Saturday night at the Atlantic City Convention Center has him dancing his way through a graveyard on the way to the ring to meet Wayne McCullough.

title: The Holocaust Meets Popular Culture
description: There was a time, when memory was sacred, that the words ''Hitler,'' ''Nazi'' and ''Gestapo'' were reserved to describe one of the most horrific events in the history of humankind.

title: Liberal, by the Book
description: To the Editor:

title: Journal; Don't Look Back
description: Let the old folks get misty-eyed about John Glenn's return to space. Here in the self-proclaimed capital of Silicon Valley -- the true epicenter of science and industry in America, 1998 -- nostalgia doesn't play. Most of those who run the high-tech industry that now fires the world and much of its economy are too young to remember the first Glenn mission. Their scientific explorations venture into virtual space, not outer space, and their means of propulsion, the microchip, must be examined through a microscope, not a telescope. The only prospect of danger comes from hair-raising gyrations of the Nasdaq exchange.

title: Democrats Fault Gingrich For His Role in Attack Ads
description: Seizing on Speaker Newt Gingrich's role in approving new Republican campaign commercials that allude to the Clinton scandal, Democrats led by Vice President Al Gore today condemned Mr. Gingrich for using the commercials as a way to gain support for impeachment.

title: Pirelli Buying Part Of Siemens Cable Unit
description: Pirelli S.p.A., Italy's largest maker of cables and tires, said yesterday that it was buying part of Siemens Power Cables A.G. of Germany with sales of 1.33 trillion lire ($790 million). The price was not disclosed.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Wednesday about the hiring of a soccer coach misspelled the surname of the president of the United States Soccer Federation. His name is Bob Contiguglia, not Catiguglia.

title: Expert on Deceptive Plays Finds Out Just How It Feels
description: A player who has written extensively about deceptive plays encountered a new one on the diagramed deal, played in September at the Beverly Club, 150 Central Park South in Manhattan. South reached four hearts after West had overcalled in spades, and won the opening club lead in dummy.

title: Excerpts From Ruling on Starr's Investigation
description: Following are excerpts from an order by Judge Norma Holloway Johnson of Federal District Court dated Sept. 25, which established her reasons for ordering members of the office of the independent counsel Kenneth W. Starr to show cause why they should not be held in contempt of court for disclosures in 24 news reports. The order was made public by the court today.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  FUOCO, ANTHONY
description: FUOCO-Anthony. Survived by two sons Charles and John, sister Gae. Reposing at Perazzo Funeral Home, 199 Bleecker Street, NYC, Saturday 2-5 and 7-9:30 PM.

title: Jewels of Talent Stud the Met's New 'Figaro'
description: Everybody knew it would be good; the question was how good? Rarely does an opera company assemble the ingredients that went into the Metropolitan Opera's new production of ''Le Nozze di Figaro.'' Mozart's opera seen afresh opened on Thursday night and what a cast: Bryn Terfel as Figaro, Renee Fleming as the Countess, Cecilia Bartoli as Susanna, Susanne Mentzer as Cherubino and Dwayne Croft as the Count. There to hold all the talent together was Jonathan Miller, the director; and making music in the pit was the estimable Met orchestra conducted by James Levine.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  SHUSTER, RITA
description: SHUSTER-Rita. Loving and devoted wife, ''world's best Mom'', step-mother, sister, aunt, 2nd Mom. Loved and adored by countless friends. Accomplished pianist, supporter of AIDS research and volunteer at the Brooklyn Museum of Art. Always with us. Services Sunday 11AM, Sherman's Funeral Home, 1283 Coney Island Ave., Brooklyn. Donations to Chamber Music Assocs., Evelyn Gilbert, 114 E. 84 St, NY, NY 10028.

title: Brazilians Are Upbeat Over I.M.F.
description: While wary of coming negotiations in Congress over an austerity package to reduce Brazil's crippling deficits, investors here celebrated today over an agreement by the industrialized nations that opens the way for replenishing International Monetary Fund coffers with $90 billion.

title: Vatican Is Investigating the Inquisition, in Secret
description: For the first time ever, the Vatican is conducting its own inquisition of the Inquisition.

title: Paid Notice: Memorials  STEINMAN BLOUSTEIN, RUTH ELEN
description: STEINMAN BLOUSTEIN-Ruth Elen. March 1, 1923-October 31, 1988. We will miss your light for the rest of our days. Daughters, Elise and Lori Son-in-law, Sam

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  GROSS, JACK
description: GROSS-Jack. Born June 17, 1909. Died on October 28th, 1998. He lived boldly and big. All who knew him knew that they could count on him, absolutely. For more than sixty years, he imported whiskies and wines as founder and senior partner of John Gross & Co. He is survived by his brother Edward; sister Anne Rayman; two sons, Michael and Stephen; and five grandchildren. A memorial service will be held 2 P.M., Sunday, November 1, at the home that he loved, 100 Kings Point Road, Great Neck, LI. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Jewish Fund for Justice, 260 5th Avenue, Suite 701, New York, New York 10001.

title: Pilots Sign Contract At Continental Unit
description: Pilots at the regional commuter unit of Continental Airlines Inc. signed a tentative contract with Contintental, the fifth-largest United States airline, today after several weeks of Federal mediation.

title: Anthony Celebrezze Is Dead; Kennedy Cabinet Member, 88
description: Anthony J. Celebrezze, a storied Cleveland mayor who transformed the city's skyline in the 1950's and went on to spend three productive years as Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare in the 1960's and three low-key decades as a Federal appellate judge, died on Thursday at a hospice in Cleveland. He was 88 and a founder of a far-flung Ohio political dynasty.

title: A Smashing Success With Only One Survivor
description: In 1965, the No. 1 pop record in the United States was ''My Girl,'' a sugary ballad sung by five young men from Detroit who called themselves the Temptations. The tale of how they reached that exalted moment, and of the tragic letdown that followed, has been dramatized in ''The Temptations,'' a four-hour film that NBC is presenting tomorrow and Monday nights.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  EISENBERG, YVETTE (NEE NEUFELD)
description: EISENBERG-Yvette (nee Neufeld). Of Woodsburgh, L.I. On October 29, 1998. Devoted wife of Alfred. Beloved mother of Jacqui, Mikel, and Jeffrey. Cherished grandmother of Daniel and Jared. Dear sister of Arlene Rubinstein, of Philadelphia, Pa. and Saul Neufeld, of Costa Mesa, Ca. She will be remembered with affection by her many nieces and nephews and dear friends. Her strength, courage and love will live in our hearts always. Funeral services will be held Sunday, November 1, 2:30PM at the ''Boulevard-Riveside Chapels'', 1450 Broadway, Hewlett, NY. Interment will take place at Wellwood Cemetery, Pinelawn, LI.

title: Is a Woman's Right to Choose in Jeopardy?
description: To the Editor:

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  TONG, DIANE
description: TONG-Diane. Author and photographer. Beloved daughter of Beatrice and Harold Deitchman. Sister of Robert Deitchman. Services at Parkside Chapels, 98-60 Queens Blvd., Forest Hills, 10 AM, Sunday, November 1.

title: LOBLAW BUYING RIVAL CANADIAN GROCERY CHAIN
description: The Loblaw Companies, Canada's biggest supermarket chain, agreed yesterday to buy Provigo Inc., the third largest, for $1.56 billion (Canadian), or $1.01 billion (United States), in cash and stock to expand in Quebec, the nation's second-most-populous province.The Toronto-based Loblaw, which owns the Loblaws and Dominion chains, will offer 0.25 Loblaw share and $7.25 (Canadian) a share in cash for each Provigo share. The terms value the Montreal-based Provigo at a 46 percent premium to its closing price Thursday of $9.90 (Canadian). Provigo is Quebec's largest grocery store operator. In Canada, Loblaw stock fell $2.25, to $28.75; Provigo rose $3.75 to $13.65.

title: Indonesia Denies It Failed to Pull Out Troops From East Timor
description: The military denied today that it had not reduced the number of its troops in disputed East Timor after the Government had announced a withdrawal.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  YOUNG, WILLIAM MARTIN
description: YOUNG-William Martin. On October 28, 1998. In his 83rd year. Beloved husband of Wanda. Loving father of Pamela and Michael and devoted grandfather of Jenita, James and Jesse. Lifelong golfer and unofficial historian of Van Cortlandt Golf course. Memorial services will be held at the Riverdale Presbyterian Church, on Saturday, November 14 at 11 AM.

title: THE MARKETS: CURRENCIES
description: DOLLAR FALLS. The dollar declined against the yen as concern continued over efforts by Brazil to cut its budget and qualify for international aid. The dollar cost 116.14 yen, down from 116.93 yen on Thursday.

title: Corrections
description: A brief report in Business Day on Friday about AT&T's plans for the At Home on-line network misstated the sales arrangement. C. Michael Armstrong, AT&T's chief executive, said that while At Home's Internet access and information offerings would be sold as one service, other companies could connect to the network to offer At Home customers their services. He did not say At Home's Internet access would be sold separately.

title: GENUINE PARTS GAINING REST OF UAP OF CANADA
description: The Genuine Parts Company agreed yesterday to acquire the remaining 80 percent of UAP Inc. of Canada that it did not already own for $356 million (Canadian), or $225 million (United States) in cash as it expands its auto and industrial-parts distribution business in Canada. Genuine Parts said it entered an agreement with members of the Prefontaine family, controlling stockholders of the Montreal-based UAP, Canada's largest auto parts distributor, who agreed to tender the 19 percent of UAP stock they own. Shares of the Atlanta-based Genuine Parts were 68.75 cents, to $31.50.

title: Pregnant Honor Student Is Missing, Family Says
description: Last Saturday shortly after 1 P.M., Kristine Kupka, a 28-year-old senior honor student at Baruch College who is five months pregnant, left the Brooklyn house she shares with five roommates for an afternoon outing with a man her family says is the father of her unborn child. She did not return.

title: IN THE CAMPAIGNS
description: BIG LEAD, BIG PLANS -- With the confidence of a 48-point lead in opinion polls, Gov. John G. Rowland boasts about a warm, flexible brand of Republicanism that he hopes someday to export beyond the borders of Connecticut. Page B1.

title: An All-Haydn Program By a Haydnesque Band
description: If the Orchestra of St. Luke's has a patron saint, it is not Luke but Joseph: Haydn, that is. Flexible in size and built around a core of chamber musicians, the orchestra fancies that it resembles the band Haydn used at the Esterhazy court in Hungary through much of his career, and the St. Luke's orchestra and its related chamber ensemble are playing an entire season of the composer's music to prove the kinship.

title: Bad Spirits Invade Village Parade; Minor Event Becomes Major and Causes Major Dissent
description: Even in Greenwich Village, no one knew quite what to make of it. It was a chilly Halloween night in 1974 and through the narrow streets came a procession that looked something like a cross between a Happening and a medieval mystery play.

title: Cone Contract Talks Are Set for Today
description: The Yankees would like David Cone to exercise the $5.5 million option in his contract for next season; Cone would like the Yankees to add something to the contract. With those different goals in mind, the two sides are scheduled to meet in Orlando, Fla., today to discuss a contract for Cone.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  MEYEROWITZ, FAY
description: MEYEROWITZ-Fay. On October 28, 1998. Beloved wife of Gilbert. Devoted mother of Sanford, and Madelyn and Jay Coppersmith. Cherished grandmother of Daniel, Joshua, Adam & Michael. Dearest sister of Stella and Ethel. Services on Sunday, 10 AM, at ''RiversideNassau North Chapels'', 55 North Station Plaza (opposite LIRR), Great Neck, New York.

title: Agent Exerts Influence On Talks With N.B.A.
description: By implying that unprofitable owners should consider selling their teams, Michael Jordan angered 74-year-old Abe Pollin on Wednesday. So much that Pollin, the Washington Wizards owner, began yelling at Jordan in front of nearly 100 players and several owners.

title: A Cosmic Vista Worth Sharing
description: Lucky John Glenn, soaring into earth orbit a second time. It's easy to understand his lifelong quest to return to space. He's responding to a uniquely human impulse, a craving for what I call deep play.

title: Sidi Saye Journal; The Thirsty Lift a Glass To a River And Qaddafi
description: This spot marks an end point of the Great Man-Made River, a $25 billion project that some have suggested may be either a financial folly or a military undertaking.

title: Gap to Create 1,000 Jobs at Fishkill Site
description: Gap Inc., the giant clothing retailer, announced yesterday that it plans to build a $150 million regional distribution center in Fishkill, N.Y., about 40 miles north of New York City, and create 1,000 jobs during the next five years.

title: Salem Journal; Witches Appeal to a Political Spirit
description: Every once in a while, a political campaign comes along to offer evidence that a particular group, whether professional, religious or geographic, has become influential and must be reckoned with.

title: The Opinion Game: We're All Players; Hanging Up on Pollsters
description: To the Editor:

title: Scores, Topless Club, Declares Bankruptcy, Citing Mafia Ties
description: After being extorted by the Mafia and battered by the city's crackdown on the sex industry, New York City's most famous topless nightclub, Scores, declared itself bankrupt yesterday.

title: Apple Executive Testifies of Threats and Bullying by Microsoft
description: Shortly after Avadis Tevanian Jr. joined Apple Computer Inc. as a senior executive last year, he recalls, a software developer warned him that if Apple did not stop selling its highly successful Quicktime multimedia software product, ''Microsoft would take any necessary action to drive Apple out of businesss.''

title: NABORS INDUSTRIES OFFERS TO ACQUIRE POOL ENERGY
description: Nabors Industries Inc. offered yesterday to acquire its rival, the Pool Energy Services Company, for $14.51 a share in cash and stock, or $486 million. Pool Energy had previously rejected a Nabors proposal to merge, Nabors said. The two Houston-based companies operate drilling and platform rigs in the Gulf of Mexico and have land drilling operations in Alaska, Saudi Arabia and elsewhere. Nabors' offer -- which consists of 0.481 Nabors share and $6.125 cash for each Energy Services share -- represents a 22.9 percent premium over the target company's closing share price Thursday of $11.8125. Shares of Pool Energy Services rose $1.4375, to $13.25.

title: A Nostalgic Hong Kong Gives Old Governor a Big Welcome
description: Christopher Patten, the outspoken last Governor of this former British colony, returned this week to a rapturous welcome from the Chinese city that sent him packing 16 months ago.

title: Delta in Accord on Frequent-Flier Suit
description: Delta Air Lines Inc., the nation's No. 3 airline, agreed today to give discounted domestic tickets and double miles to some disgruntled frequent-flier program members as part of a tentative lawsuit settlement.

title: B Sky B Digital Sales Exceed Forecasts
description: British Sky Broadcasting Group P.L.C., Europe's No. 2 satellite broadcaster, won 100,400 subscribers for its new digital television service in its first month, matching analysts' best forecasts.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Judges in Spain Assert Pinochet Can Face Trial
description: In a landmark ruling, an 11-member panel of senior Spanish judges decided unanimously today that Spain had the legal right to bring criminal charges against Chile's former dictator, Gen. Augusto Pinochet, and to seek his extradition from Britain.

title: D'Amato and Schumer Make Appeals to Core Supporters
description: As the fiercely contested Senate race entered its final weekend, Representative Charles E. Schumer campaigned across Queens and Brooklyn with President Clinton yesterday, appearing before elderly groups, Jewish Democrats and black ministers in communities where a strong Democratic turnout is essential for Mr. Schumer to win.

title: QUOTATION OF THE DAY
description: ''If you have 10 people at a protest, they don't do much of anything. If you have 10 people on line, they could cripple a network.''

title: Japan's Old Values Are No Less Worthy; Bottom-Line Thinking
description: To the Editor:

title: Car Outside Macy's Strikes Three People
description: A car that had locked bumpers with a truck backed onto the sidewalk at 34th Street and Broadway outside Macy's department store yesterday and struck three people. None were seriously injured.

title: Paid Notice: Deaths  GALIANO, MICHAEL C.
description: GALIANO-Michael C., Ret. Major General. Of Croton, New York. Formerly of Bronxville, NY. On Thursday, October 29, 1998. He was 92. General Galiano who served during W.W. II retired from the N.Y. Army National Guard as Assistant Division Commander on May 23, 1966. On April 22, 1928 he married Cecelia J. Sparacio at St. Jerome's Church in the Bronx. Mrs. Galiano passed away in December 1974. He is survived by three children, Joseph J. of Bronxville, NY; Mrs. Ronald M. Charlotte McGowan of New Rochelle, NY; & Thomas M. of Miami, FL; sister Eva Amonte of Middle Island, NY; five grandchildren: Mark, Matthew and Melanie McGowan of New Rochelle and Michael, Robb and the late Christopher Galiano of FL; and six great-grandchildren. For further information please contact Flynn Memorial Home, Yonkers, NY: 914-963-5178.

title: Rule Proposed On Buybacks
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission proposed a rule change today that would extend legal protections to companies that repurchase their own stock immediately after a marketwide trading halt.

title: Economic News And an Accord On I.M.F. Push Stocks Higher
description: Stock prices barreled ahead yesterday after industrialized countries agreed on a new mechanism for stabilizing distressed economies and the United States said its growth was faster over the summer than analysts had predicted.

title: Norwegian Bank Deal Upset by New Bid
description: Svenska Handelsbanken A.B. upset a planned three-way Norwegian bank merger yesterday by offering $691 million in cash for Fokus Bank A.S.A., Norway's fifth-largest bank, taking advantage of the country's fragmented banking industry.

title: Debate Over Vouchers
description: To the Editor:

title: In Marathon, as on Broadway, Debuts Can Be Triumphant
description: Of the 32,000 runners in tomorrow's New York City Marathon, approximately 12,000 will be competing in their first race of 26.2 miles. While many simply want to finish, it would surprise no one if a first-timer won.

title: Corrections
description: A listing in the Spare Times column in some editions of Weekend yesterday for the 22d Village Halloween Costume Ball misstated the date. The event, at the Theater for the New City, 155 First Avenue, at 10th Street, in the East Village, will take place today starting at 5 P.M. It was not held yesterday.
